JavaScript is either disabled or not supported by your browser. For instructions on how to enable JavaScript in your browser, click here . Language Study                                                                   Course Evaluations       NYU's Global Academic Centers offer a wide variety of courses from schools and departments across the University. Student evaluations for these courses are administered online during the closing weeks of each semester. While the evaluation survey instrument can vary slightly based on the course location and sponsoring department, all surveys meet the guidelines set by the Undergraduate Academic Affairs Committee. A sample survey can be seen here .   Course evaluation results from the Global Academic Centers are now available to the entire NYU community. The level of access to evaluation data varies depending on the user's role. Click the appropriate drop down menu below to access evaluation results.                                                    Students                               Students with a valid netID may access quantitative results for courses which had an enrollment greater than five students and a survey response rate greater than 20%. To access results log in with netID and password here: NYU Global Course Evaluation Results .                                                              Global Academic Center Faculty                               Instructors will be emailed PDF results of their individual results at the conclusion of each semester, after grades have been submitted. In addition, instructors can access evaluation results online here: NYU Global Course Evaluation results . Log in with NYU netID and password is required. If you have your netID but are unsure of your password go to start.nyu.edu to reset your password. If you do not know your netID, please contact global.academics@nyu.edu .   You will find reports for classes you taught under your Eval Center (the landing page; also accessed by clicking EvalCenter in the navigation at the top). If it is near the end of a semester, you can also see when surveys will be available for courses you are currently teaching, preview the survey instrument, and email a reminder to your students from the system if the evaluation period is currently underway.   You also have access to view limited quantitative results for the evaluations of other courses taught at the Global Academic Centers. To view the general results select "School" from the navigation header bar as shown here . (Please note that you will need to exit this view and navigate back to Survey Results in order to view the more detailed quantitative and qualitative data for your courses.)                                                                School Deans and Department Leadership                               Relevant personnel from sponsoring schools and departments have full access to the quantitative and qualitative evaluation results for their courses online. Course sponsors will be notified when results are available at the conclusion of each semester.   Viewing Results   To view results, click here: NYU Global Course Evaluation Results , and log in with your netID and password.     Once you log in you'll probably want to select Survey Results (this gives you the most options and lets you review results online) or Email PDF Reports (this lets you quickly email yourself all evaluations as PDFs so you can easily print them out). If you elect to view Survey Results you will first be shown higher level results at the school/department level. If you are interested in viewing an indivdual course simply select a school and then department using any of the links on the page. You'll then be able to use drop down menus to select a particular course/instructor/semester etc. Further instructions are available in the guides below       Basic Couse Evaluation Reporting Guide - an overview of basic features     Filtering with Demographic Data Guide - how to filter results based on students' school, year, etc.     You also have access to view limited quantitative results for the evaluations of other courses taught at the Global Academic Centers. To view the general results select "School" from the navigation header bar as shown here . (Please note that you will need to exit this view and navigate back to Survey Results in order to view the more detailed quantitative and qualitative data for your courses.)     Who has access?     Deans, Department Chairs, and other relevant personnel from sponsoring (and crosslisting) departments and schools have full access to the results of their courses. If you would like to request access for yourself or a colleague or have difficulty logging into the system please email global.academics@nyu.edu .   Evaluation Preparation and Administration   Evaluations are conducted by the Office of Global Programs Academic Support team. If you have a question about how surveying is conducted or would like to make a special request regarding the surveys for the courses your department sponsors please contact global.academics@nyu.edu                                                                Global Academic Center and Global Programs Staff                               Relevant personnel from the Office of Global Programs and Global Academic Centers have full access to the quantitative and qualitative evaluation results for courses at their site(s) online.   Viewing Results   To view results, cick here: NYU Global Course Evaluation Results , and log in with your netID and password.     Once you log in you'll probably want to select Survey Results (this gives you the most options and lets you review results online) or Email PDF Reports (this lets you quickly email yourself all evaluations as PDFs so you can easily print them out). If you elect to view Survey Results you will first be shown higher level results at the school/department level. If you are interested in viewing an indivdual course simply select a school and then department using any of the links on the page. You'll then be able to use drop down menus to select a particular course/instructor/semester etc. Further instructions are available in the guides below     Basic Course Evaluation Reporting Guide - an overview of basic features   Filtering with Demographic Data Guide - how to filter results based on students' school, year, etc.   Comparative Rankings Report Guide - how to create a list that ranks courses by specific questions (for example course overall).     You also have access to view limited quantitative results for the evaluations of other courses taught at the Global Academic Centers. To view the general results select "School" from the navigation header bar as shown here . (Please note that you will need to exit this view and navigate back to Survey Results in order to view the more detailed quantitative and qualitative data for your courses.)     Who has access?   Senior leadership in the Office of Global Programs and Office of the Provost have access to all evaluations. Site directors and other relevant personnel have access to evaluations at a given site. If you would like to request access for yourself or a colleague or have difficulty logging into the system please email global.academics@nyu.edu .   Evaluation Preparation and Administration   Please visit the Evaluations page on the Global Programs Staff Wiki for additional information and resources on Global Programs Course Evaluations.                                                                All Other NYU Community Members                               Members of the NYU community with a valid netID may access quantitative results for courses which had an enrollment greater than five students and a survey response rate greater than 20%. To access results log in with netID and password here: NYU Global Course Evaluation Results .                        NYU Global Academic Center Course Evaluations are conducted and reported using Smart Evals, a product of Gap, Technologies Inc.                                                        Notes regarding historical evaluation results in the Smart Evals System                               Semesters Available   The Global Academic Center course evaluation results available in the Smart Evals system date back to Spring 2008. Terms prior to Spring 2011* were conducted on paper and open-ended comments are not available online. In most cases scanned copies of the original student responses are on file at the Office of Global Programs. Email global.academics@nyu.edu for access to these scanned copies or for inquiries about evaluation data from semesters prior to spring 2008.   Subject Heading Conversions   Prior to summer 2011 NYU operated under a different course numbering sequence in regard to subject headings using a one letter two digit code for subject headings (eg. V45). All subject headings have been converted to the current subject heading in the Smart Evals system (i.e. V45 was changed to FREN-UA). Email global.academics@nyu.edu should you have any questions regarding a subject heading conversion.   *CAS Summer Programs transitioned to online evaluations in Summer 2010. NYU Florence transitioned to online evaluations in Fall 2010.                                                             Courses by location... Stern School of Business, and Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development:                  College of Arts and Science      Connect to the CAS Course Evaluation Guide .                      Global Academic Centers      View course evaluation results from courses offered at NYU's Global Academic Centers.                      Leonard N. Stern School of Business      Connect to the Course Faculty Evaluations webpage on the Stern Web Information System (AIS).     This page allows students with access to AIS to view course evaluation data for undergraduate and graduate courses. Only students currently enrolled in Stern courses have access to AIS.                      Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development      Connect to the Steinhardt Course Evaluation Guide .      If you have evaluations to complete, click here .                                                 Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright New York University. All rights reserved.
